page.title: 17RECREATION (ii)
page.content: All houses here have gardens and gardening is undoubtedly the commonest recreation. Most gardens are well kept and productive. Out of doors, horse riding, driving a pony and trap and the occasional shoot, and indoors yoga, church choir and scrabble parties all take place locally. The Hunt meets here occasionally.Those interested in fishing, swimming, amateur dramatics,photography & bingo, join with other communities.One man spends his leisure at the East Anglia Transport Museum of which he is founder member & secretary. Apart from darts, the various teams attached to the pub - football, cricket,bed & raft racing - must find a ground for their amusement elsewhere. An adventure playground for the children is to be built in our small Parish field this Autumn.
